mods.note: 2 tifs. A nurse stands near the door of the empty hospital ward. The windows are opened at the top for ventilation. Verso side reads: Inside picture of Ward 2, showing about one third of the ward. The Mountain Branch of the National Home for Disabled Volunteer Soldiers in Johnson City, Tennessee housed a hospital with four wards. The hospital at this time was used to care for minor injuries, and was intended more as an infirmary. The Branch could house nearly 4,000 soldiers and was self-sufficient, even including amusement for the veterans including a baseball field and a zoo.
